title: NFS: The Photographic Baseball Cards of Goodwin & Company (1886-1890)
author: Kawika

posts.post_title: NFS: The Photographic Baseball Cards of Goodwin & Company (1886-1890)
posts.post_content: They'll pry my copy of the Old Judge book from my cold dead hands. It is like the Torah of baseball cards, the origins of our cardboard religion.
Was looking thru mine last night.  So comprehensive, its almost overwhelming!
With an assist from Young Frankenstein

My Life in Baseball by David McDonald

[IMG]http://photos.imageevent.com/kawika_o_ka_pakipika/sportscardsetc/mischidden/miscellanybaseball/websize/Baseball%20Fan.jpg[/IMG]
David-Thanks for the kind words. I was starting to worry that the book caused rashes (or worse).
My problem is that I need two copies. I have homes in two states and it seems like the book is wherever I am not!

[quote name="Jim VB" post=865669]My problem is that I need two copies. I have homes in two states and it seems like the book is wherever I am not![/QUOTE]

Jim - That sounds like a good problem to have, and probably would be a good idea for you to go ahead and pick up a 2nd copy for 2nd house.

Go ahead, splurge a little...  :rolleyes:

[quote name="NashvilleBaseball" post=866107]Jim - That sounds like a good problem to have,...[/QUOTE]


Not as good as it sounds. One has been on the market for a while (8 months.)
Jim - Seems to be happening everywhere as I have a handful of friends in the same boat right now... Things will come around... This country will bounce - Best of Luck to you on getting her sold!

Without a doubt, arguably one of the best hobby books published.  

It was agony just waiting for it to be published/released...
